text: this is a moment for Israel and America
to take stock of their relationship so
here are Netanyahu and Trump's four
priorities first and foremost this is a
chance to reset Israeli American
relations at the top Obama didn't get on
so well with Netanyahu but now I think
he's good and I like him strong she's
always been be strong plus Trump has
promised to be the most pro-israel
president ever you know I'm the best
thing that could ever happen to Israel
so be prepared for lots of mutual
admiration I plan to speak soon with
President Trump about how to counter the
threat of the Iranian regime which calls
for Israel's destruction at the top of
Netanyahu's agenda is Iran both leaders
are fierce critics of Obama's deal to
curb Iran's nuclear program this is a
bad deal it's a very bad deal I think
was the worst deal I've ever seen
negotiated Netanyahu wants to scrap the
agreement Trump is more likely to
enforce it vigorously and take an
overall harder line against Iran as of
today we are officially putting Iran on
notice thank you then there's the battle
against the so-called Islamic state
Trump has vowed to crush the group in
Syria Netanyahu is all for that but he
doesn't want any of this to spill over
Israel's shared border with Syria plus
Israel may want American help to foster
covert cooperation with some Arab
countries on counterterrorism and also
on a shared desire to counter Iran
finally the hot ticket question Trump's
policy for peace with the Palestinians
he wants to know
Netanyahu's plan he's still forming his
own and it seems to stray from bedrock
u.s. positions which are support for a
Palestinian state and opposition to
Jewish settlements built on Israeli
occupied land expected to form part of
that state Trump the candidate said
Israel should keep building but Trump
the president's been cautiously rowing
back we don't believe that the existence
of current settlements is an impediment
to peace but I think the construction or
expansion of existing settlements beyond
the current borders is not going to be
helpful moving forward so Netanyahu is
also seeking a better read on trumps
future decisions campaign promises are
one thing complicated realities are
there especially if the president is a
businessman who harbors hopes of making
the ultimate deal on Mideast peace
